maybe we could come up with a better syntax, but I've been so badly burned =
by java generics this year I don't want to go there ever again.

In the mea=
ntime, there is another matcher that compares all the bean properties of tw=
o objects.

S.

rently available features of Java, I guess less verbose tests are impossibl=

tax could be used for this:

lOf( hasProperty ("name", "Bread"), hasProperty ("price", 15) ),

 hasProperty ("name", "Apple"), hasProperty ("price", 5),

perties( {"name": "Bread", "price": 15} ),
